reg:regulation.reg:title: First Nations Trust Property Transfer Tax Exemption Regulation

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Property Transfer Tax Act;
first nation means a band as defined in the Indian Act (Canada).

bcl:section.bcl:text: Subject to the conditions set out in section 3, a transferee who applies for registration of a taxable transaction at a land title office is exempt from the obligation to pay tax under section 2 (1) (a) of the Act.
The exemption under section 2 applies if all of the following conditions are met:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: at the time of registration, the transferor is an individual who

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: holds a property in trust for a first nation, and
is registered under the Land Title Act as a trustee of the property;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the transferee is an entity that is not an individual and that, immediately after registration,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: holds the property in trust for the first nation, and
is registered under the Land Title Act as a trustee of that property;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the change in trustee is for reasons that do not relate, directly or indirectly,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: to a change in beneficiaries or in a class of beneficiaries of the trust, or
to a change in the terms of the trust, other than in respect of the trustee.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Property Transfer Tax Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 378, s. 37.]
